title: A quick question about the assassin updates
body: Has riot already locked down the changes they are doing to the champs?  The 3 posts so far seem to talk in generalities which suggests they might not be done with what is going to happen, but part of me thinks that riot wouldn't mention the champs being reworked until they knew exactly what they were going to do with them.

replies.body: We've got directions for the kits, with some specific changes we're pretty confident in and some stuff that's still in testing. We're trying to hit a sweet spot with the posts where we're hopefully early enough we can incorporate feedback around the posts into kit development if appropriate but also late enough that we can talk with confidence about which champions we'll be changing and what the high level intent of those changes is.
Cool, thank you for the reply.  I hope you guys find the sweet spot you are looking for.
How can players posts provide any meaningful feedback if you only posted vague idea of what you are doing without any details?

Based on the comments they make in the replies, they have kits that they plan to use.  They tend to avoid too many specifics in these posts so that they can change if it turns out that the idea doesn't work out.  If, for example, they had said, "Talon's E will drop a field where all his autos are dashes ala Rengar from a bush/stealth", but then figured out that it wasn't a good idea, people would complain about a bait and switch.  This way, they have a skill set in mind, but can change it if need be, as long as they stay in the general direction they specified.
